learning_outcomes.description: Critically appraise the food supply for a nutritionally dependant group including cultural appropriateness
Apply contemporary best practice guidelines for a nutritionally dependant food service system
Synthesise data from multiple sources to assess risk associated with a food system and to nutritionally dependant individuals
Apply a sustainability lens to the food service system
Demonstrate team work and collaborative working skills
Seek out, and proactively engage in feedback processes to improve professional practice performance

assessments.due_date:
Quiz 1 4/08/2025 5:00 pm

Quiz 2 11/08/2025 5:00 pm

Quiz 3 20/08/2025 5:00 pm

Quiz 4 27/08/2025 5:00 pm

Each quiz will open following the associated workshop e.g. Workshop 1 is timetabled to run 31/07/2025, Quiz 1 will become available that afternoon and students have until 04/08/2025 5:00pm to complete.
assessments.task_description: Each quiz will consist of 10 multiple choice questions randomly selected from a pool of questions for each module. The quizzes can be completed at any time before the due date, however, once the quiz commences, students will have a maximum of 20 minutes to complete the quiz. Only one attempt at each quiz is allowed.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed as an online quiz via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will complete an individual menu review assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Executive Summary

Due 5:00pm, Monday following the last day of the relevant placement block.

Presentation

Presented in allocated time on 27/11/2025
assessments.task_description: Students (in their placement pairs/groups) will produce a 3-page executive summary, a report to be provided to the professional practice site and deliver a presentation in dedicated workshop time of their professional practice project findings.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site. All students must submit a copy of the Executive Summary, Report, and Presentation (a copy of slides).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Placement Plan and Feedback Action (Learning Plan)

Due 5:00pm, end of week 1 of relevant placement block

Competency Assessment - Interim Assessment

Due 5:00pm, end of week 2 of relevant placement block

Competency Assessment - Final Assessment

Due 5:00pm, end of week 5 of relevant placement block
assessments.task_description:
Placement Preparation and Progress includes two components:

1) Placement Plan and Feedback Action (Learning plan). Students must complete this plan in preparation for placement by end of week 1 of relevant placement block.

2) Competency Assessment- Students must complete this competency assessment at the end of the relevant placement block in week 2 (interim assessment) and week 5 (final assessment). The assessment will be sent to their professional practice project supervisors for feedback.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant ePortfolio submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Professional practice

Students will complete 20 days of placement in Foodservice Management in either Block 1 or 2 (on Tuesdays to Fridays). Students can view their placement details on InPlace.

Block 1: Tuesday 9th September - Friday 10th October

Block 2: Tuesday 14th October - Friday 14th November

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
